content:
Diagnosis:		Rectal verrucous carcinoma

Management:		Anterior resection March 2024

Histology:		pT2N0M0 verrucous carcinoma, MMR proficient, p16 negative

Current situation:	Post-operative surveillance

[redacted name] attended follow-up clinic today following anterior resection for early stage rectal cancer. The post-operative period has been uncomplicated with good recovery of bowel function. Currently opening bowels 2-3 times daily with good continence. No concerning symptoms reported. Performance status remains 0. Weight stable at 72kg. Digital rectal examination today shows healthy anastomosis with no palpable abnormality. Blood tests including CEA are within normal range. The plan is to continue standard surveillance with next CT chest/abdomen/pelvis in 3 months' time and colonoscopy at 1 year post-surgery. Will review again in clinic following CT scan.
